data.enText: in business/economy

data.chText: （贸易和经济活动的）激增，繁荣
data.enText: a sudden increase in trade and economic activity; a period of wealth and success
a boom in car sales

data.chText: 在战后那段繁荣昌盛的时期里，生活水平得到了迅速提高。
data.enText: Living standards improved rapidly during the post-war boom.
a boom year (for trade, exports, etc.)

data.chText: 房地产 / 住房的迅速发展
data.enText: a property/housing boom

data.chText: 经济繁荣与经济萧条交替出现的混乱时期
data.enText: a chaotic period of boom and bust
popular period

data.chText: （某种体育运动、音乐等）突然风靡的时期
data.enText: a period when sth such as a sport or a type of music suddenly becomes very popular and successful

data.chText: 满足这场高尔夫球热的唯一途径是增建球场。
data.enText: The only way to satisfy the golf boom was to build more courses.
on boat
a long pole that the bottom of a sail is attached to and that you move to change the position of the sail
sound
a loud deep sound
the distant boom of the guns
in river/harbour
a floating barrier that is placed across a river or the entrance to a harbour to prevent ships or other objects from coming in or going out
for microphone
a long pole that carries a microphone or other equipment
make loud sound
to make a loud deep sound

data.chText: 外面雷声隆隆，霹雳炸响。
data.enText: Outside, thunder boomed and crashed.
to say sth in a loud deep voice

data.chText: “别让我再见到你！”他低沉而有力地说。
data.enText: ‘Get out of my sight!’ he boomed.

data.chText: 黑暗中传来低沉有力的嗓音。
data.enText: A voice boomed out from the darkness.
He had a booming voice .
of business/economy

data.chText: 迅速发展；激增；繁荣昌盛
data.enText: to have a period of rapid growth; to become bigger, more successful, etc.

data.chText: 到20世纪80年代时，计算机行业迅猛发展。
data.enText: By the 1980s, the computer industry was booming.
Business is booming!

means: (某种体育运动、音乐等)突然风靡的时期

ex.enText: His business seemed to be flourishing.

ex.chText: 在过去的10年里，乡镇企业蓬勃发展。
ex.enText: Township enterprises have flourished over the past 10 years.
The service industry is flourishing day by day.
The plants are flourishing and the flowers are blooming.

synonyms.bx: 指经济、事业等发展迅速或取得巨大成功，也指植物茁壮成长。

ex.chText: 如今数字出版业迅猛发展。
ex.enText: The digital publishing industry is booming nowadays.

ex.chText: 那个国家的捕鱼业在19世纪90年代繁荣一时。
ex.enText: The fishing industry of that country was booming in the 1890s.

synonyms.bx: 指商业、贸易等进入快速发展时期，规模更大、更成功。

ex.chText: 他靠着坚毅顽强和勤劳不懈发达起来了。
ex.enText: With great perseverance and untiring industry, he prospered.

ex.chText: 在新任总裁的领导下公司生意兴隆。
ex.enText: The business prospered under the leadership of the new president.

ex.chText: 引进新的管理系统后，他的公司业务兴旺起来。
ex.enText: His business prospered after introducing a new management system.

synonyms.bx: 指人、企业等经营有方，经济上获利颇丰。

ex.chText: 乡村的空气使孩子们茁壮成长。
ex.enText: Children thrive in the country air.

ex.chText: 下过雨后这些植物长势喜人。
ex.enText: The plants throve after the rain.

ex.chText: 既然这条公路已经竣工，那个商业中心一定会兴隆起来。
ex.enText: Now that the highway is finished, the shopping centre should thrive/flourish/prosper.

synonyms.bx: 指人、动植物健康茁壮成长；也指经济繁荣发展，作此义解时常可与 flourish 或 prosper 换用。

trans: （人）用低沉洪亮的声音说；（大炮或大鼓）发隆隆声

tr: any of various more-or-less horizontal spars or poles used to extend the foot of a sail or for handling cargo or in mooring
a pole carrying an overhead microphone projected over a film or tv set
a sudden happening that brings good fortune (as a sudden opportunity to make money)
example: the demand for testing has created a boom for those unregulated laboratories where boxes of specimen jars are processed like an assembly line
The deer population in this town is thriving
Her voice booms out the words of the song

tr: make a resonant sound, like artillery
example: His deep voice boomed through the hall

tr: be the case that thunder is being heard
example: Whenever it thunders, my dog crawls under the bed

value.def: If there is a boom in the economy, there is an increase in economic activity, for example in the amount of things that are being bought and sold.

example.ex: An economic boom followed, especially in housing and construction...
example.tran: 接着出现了经济繁荣，尤其是在房地产业和建筑业。
20世纪80年代是真正的繁荣时期。

example.ex: ...the cycle of boom and bust which has damaged us for 40 years.
example.tran: 40年来给我们造成巨大破坏的经济繁荣与萧条的交替循环

value.def: A boom in something is an increase in its amount, frequency, or success.

example.ex: The boom in the sport's  popularity has meant more calls for stricter safety regulations...
example.tran: 该项体育运动的兴起意味着制定更加严格的安全规则的呼声更高了。

example.ex: Public transport has not been able to cope adequately with the travel boom.
example.tran: 公共交通系统还不能充分满足迅速发展的旅游业的需求。

gramarinfo.label: usu sing, with supp, oft N <l>in</l> n

value.tran: （数量的）增长；（频率的）加快；成功

value.def: If the economy or a business is booming, the amount of things being bought or sold is increasing.

example.ex: It has a booming tourist industry.
example.tran: 其旅游产业在蓬勃发展。

value.def: On a boat, the boom is the long pole which is attached to the bottom of the sail and to the mast and which you move when you want to alter the direction in which you are sailing.
A boom is a large floating barrier that is used for stopping oil that has spilled from spreading.
value.tran: 浮木挡栅，水栅（用来阻挡溢出的油扩散）

value.def: When something such as someone's voice, a cannon, or a big drum booms, it makes a loud, deep sound that lasts for several seconds.

example.ex: 'Ladies,' boomed Helena, without a microphone, 'we all know why we're  here tonight.'...
example.tran: “女士们，”海伦娜大声喊道，没有用麦克风，“我们都知道今晚我们为什么来到这里。”

example.ex: Thunder boomed like battlefield cannons over Crooked Mountain.
example.tran: 雷声像战场上的炮声一样响彻克鲁克德山。
喇叭中传出低沉的音乐声。

example.ex: A megaphone boomed out, 'This is the police.'
example.tran: …扩音器响了起来：“我们是警察。”

example.ex: He turned his sightless eyes their way and boomed out a greeting.
example.tran: 他将失明的双眼转向他们，低声打了个招呼。

example.ex: The stillness of night was broken by the boom of a cannon.
example.tran: 夜晚的寂静被隆隆的炮声打破。

value.tran: （人)吼叫；（大炮或大鼓）发隆隆声

trans: 兴旺时期；繁荣时期；景气时期
音爆，声爆，声震(飞机超声速飞行时发出的巨大声响)
